summary: Feature request to support weighted random polling of multiple task queues in the TypeScript SDK to implement priority-like functionality and prevent starvation, similar to Faktory workers. The maintainer indicated this requires platform-level support from the Temporal server.
userImpact: Users cannot implement priority-based task processing without complex workarounds, limiting ability to handle critical tasks before bulk processing.
rootCause: Temporal server does not support priority queues at the platform level, preventing SDK-level implementation.
proposedFix: Add support for taskQueue as either an array of queue names, an object with weighted queues (e.g., {critical: 10, default: 1}), or a function to select the next queue dynamically.
workaround: Create multiple workers with different configurations and use maxConcurrentActivityTaskPolls to manage concurrency per worker.
resolutionDetails: Platform-level feature that requires Temporal server support. Implementation deferred pending server-side priority queue support (temporal/temporal#1507).
keyQuote: Priority queues is a platform level feature that is not currently supported. Once Temporal server adds support for this, we can add it to the SDK.
